businessProfile.formatted_address: 302 Industrial Ct SE Unit I, Leesburg, VA 20175, USA

reviews.text: So delicious.  We stumbled on this Mom and Pop restaurant that offers a variety of Italian, Mediterranean and Greek dishes.  I had the Greek salad with grilled chicken, my husband had the Gyro platter and Italian wedding soup.  We were able to fit splitting a Tiramisu üòä Jason our server was very attentive.

We recently had the pleasure of dining at Mama Lucci‚Äôs in Leesburg, and it was an experience to remember! The restaurant offers an incredible fusion of authentic Egyptian, Italian, and Greek cuisine, catering to a variety of tastes with unmatched flavor and authenticity.

A heartfelt thank you to the owner Mustafa and his wife, whose dedication and hospitality truly set this place apart. They went above and beyond to ensure our group of 40+ was comfortably seated, served promptly, and treated with the utmost care and attention.

The food was absolutely delicious‚Äîevery dish was crafted to perfection, showcasing bold and fresh flavors that left everyone impressed. The service was exceptional, with staff members displaying professionalism, kindness, and warmth throughout our visit. Despite our large group, everything was delivered on time, and every detail was thoughtfully attended to.

Mama Lucci‚Äôs is a gem for anyone looking to enjoy a unique and memorable culinary experience. We can‚Äôt recommend it enough and look forward to returning soon!

This is our go to for family outings that are casual b/c it has something for everyone. Everyone has a favorite and as a vegetarian, I always have a variety of options. I've lost count how many times we've gone here.  Always great service.  Great comfort food choices.  I will say the atmosphere is OK given there are only windows at the front, it's a little dark.  Good value.  I most always get the eggplant parmesan combo.

Highly recommended, excellent atmosphere, service, and food, reasonably priced.

Definitely recommended

It's not out on the main drag it's off the beaten path off industrial Road,

They will however charge you extra for paying other credit card

I was in town for work and to my delight I found Mama Lucci's. I had the Gyro platter with the Greek salad. Everything was delicious. The Tzatziki sauce was flavorful but not over powering. The meat was perfect, again the flavor was spot on and it was tender as well.

I highly recommend Mam Lucci's to anyone that likes Mediterranean fare. üëç üëçüëç

editorial_summary.overview: Unassuming eatery serving Italian favorites bolstered by Greek & Middle Eastern options.

recentReviews.text: This is our favorite restaurant. Every items on the menu are interesting. We found ourselves ordered different things every time we visited and they're always excellent! Service always good as well. Nothing to complain of. Will definitely come back again!
Top notch service, fair prices, excellent food!

So delicious.  We stumbled on this Mom and Pop restaurant that offers a variety of Italian, Mediterranean and Greek dishes.  I had the Greek salad with grilled chicken, my husband had the Gyro platter and Italian wedding soup.  We were able to fit splitting a Tiramisu üòä Jason our server was very attentive.

Mama Lucci‚Äôs in Leesburg has been the go to staple place for GREAT food for MANY years‚Ä¶. The staff is always very friendly‚Ä¶ and Mama is usually there to greet the customers‚Ä¶ The cream of potato soup is absolutely the best!!!

Mama Lucci's is a hidden gem that's long been in Leesburg.  Carolina's recipes are fabulous.  They're consistently right on timigs for pickup and prices are reasonable.  It's really easy to order online or call in.  They have a huge variety of foods.  The kabob platters, Italian sausage sub, potato soup with bacon, antipasto salad, gyro salads are all delicious.  They even do a great job with catering.  You'll short yourself if you don't check it out!  Yum!
A superb, small Ristorante Italiano.  The kitchen turns out Italian and Greek creations, tutto sempre molto Feliciano!

detailedReviews.author: Jenny J
detailedReviews.text: This is our favorite restaurant. Every items on the menu are interesting. We found ourselves ordered different things every time we visited and they're always excellent! Service always good as well. Nothing to complain of. Will definitely come back again!

detailedReviews.author: Lisa Krueger
detailedReviews.text: Top notch service, fair prices, excellent food!

detailedReviews.author: Lori Humbarger
detailedReviews.text: So delicious.  We stumbled on this Mom and Pop restaurant that offers a variety of Italian, Mediterranean and Greek dishes.  I had the Greek salad with grilled chicken, my husband had the Gyro platter and Italian wedding soup.  We were able to fit splitting a Tiramisu üòä Jason our server was very attentive.

detailedReviews.author: Tony Lynn
detailedReviews.text: Mama Lucci‚Äôs in Leesburg has been the go to staple place for GREAT food for MANY years‚Ä¶. The staff is always very friendly‚Ä¶ and Mama is usually there to greet the customers‚Ä¶ The cream of potato soup is absolutely the best!!!

detailedReviews.author: The Flock
detailedReviews.text: Mama Lucci's is a hidden gem that's long been in Leesburg.  Carolina's recipes are fabulous.  They're consistently right on timigs for pickup and prices are reasonable.  It's really easy to order online or call in.  They have a huge variety of foods.  The kabob platters, Italian sausage sub, potato soup with bacon, antipasto salad, gyro salads are all delicious.  They even do a great job with catering.  You'll short yourself if you don't check it out!  Yum!

detailedReviews.author: Your Name_Here
detailedReviews.text: A superb, small Ristorante Italiano.  The kitchen turns out Italian and Greek creations, tutto sempre molto Feliciano!

detailedReviews.author: Crystal Lynn
detailedReviews.text: Food was good , I got stuffed shells and appetizer of cheese sticks , onion rings and zucchini my son got spaghetti and I forget what my husband got, but it was good as well

detailedReviews.author: John Ko
detailedReviews.text: This is our go to for family outings that are casual b/c it has something for everyone. Everyone has a favorite and as a vegetarian, I always have a variety of options. I've lost count how many times we've gone here.  Always great service.  Great comfort food choices.  I will say the atmosphere is OK given there are only windows at the front, it's a little dark.  Good value.  I most always get the eggplant parmesan combo.

detailedReviews.author: Bob Rothenhoefer
detailedReviews.text: This is the best Italian restaurant in Leesburg, a hidden gem. The food is authentic, and portions are generous and reasonably priced. We had great service. My wife loved the Eggplant Parmesan, me, the spaghetti, and meatballs. We're coming back next week.

detailedReviews.author: Alec Scheller
detailedReviews.text: Perfect thin crust pizza

detailedReviews.author: Pat Frick
detailedReviews.text: I loved the Greek for and Italian. I was not crazy about the fish

detailedReviews.author: Richard Freed
detailedReviews.text: Very frustrating. I placed a Grubhub order expecting it to be ready on arrival, but when I got to the restaurant, they hadn't even checked the app. They only started making the pizza once I showed them the order invoice on the email from Grubhub which resulted in me having to wait additional 15‚Äì20 minutes.

detailedReviews.author: Melanie Beeler
detailedReviews.text: Family time is amazing at Mamma Luccis!! The waitress remembers our drinks and what we enjoy eating. They always greet us with a smile when we arrive. Quick service, great food, fair prices. My kid's enjoy eating here. The soups are incredible. We have had a variety of items from the menu and haven't been disappointed!!

detailedReviews.author: Nereida Thompson
detailedReviews.text: Friendly

detailedReviews.author: Kelly Wing
detailedReviews.text: We can always depend upon Mama Lucci‚Äôs for a wonderful lunch or dinner. With quick and friendly service and delicious foods.

detailedReviews.author: Dan Lynch
detailedReviews.text: I placed an online order for dinner and it was very easy to navigate, however did not scroll downward in the choice menu to customize my selections.  I will remember next time I order.  Overall, food was flavorful, hot and delivered when promised. Mama Lucia's is a step up from Piasono's where the food is inconsistent and very salty in flavor.

detailedReviews.author: Ed Higgins
detailedReviews.text: Thank you Carolina for all for your wonderful food and passionate support of the Relay for Life's Survivor Luncheon yesterday.  Our cancer survivor's were overwhelmed with your wonderful Italian dishes.  As always, your food was fresh and tasty.  That said, your meatballs are out of this world!  Thank you!!!

detailedReviews.author: zahra dar
detailedReviews.text: We ordered the chicken and vegetable soup, lobster ravioli, and a curated fettuccini dish all of which were delicious. The best part is that they have so many halal options on the menu. I would highly recommend the spot and will definitely be coming back to try other dishes.

detailedReviews.author: Roberta Holcombe
detailedReviews.text: This is always such a relaxing stop when we want a fuss free lunch or dinner.  Never have any issues, everyone is so nice.   Food is pretty good too.  The falafel and baklava are favorites.  I like that they have so many choices beyond Mediterranean and Italian, always something for everyone.

detailedReviews.author: William Miller
detailedReviews.text:
I was in town for work and to my delight I found Mama Lucci's. I had the Gyro platter with the Greek salad. Everything was delicious. The Tzatziki sauce was flavorful but not over powering. The meat was perfect, again the flavor was spot on and it was tender as well.

I highly recommend Mam Lucci's to anyone that likes Mediterranean fare. üëç üëçüëç

detailedReviews.author: Bill Leake
detailedReviews.text: Have Been Enjoying Mama Lucci's For Over 25 years. Always the best!

detailedReviews.author: Jackie Orlich
detailedReviews.text: Always a five! Love this place!!

detailedReviews.author: Liam Hughes
detailedReviews.text:
Decent food for a decent price. The taste was a bit bland, overall. But maybe that's just because I'm used to too much salt and too much butter. Either way, it meant the meal just wasn't impressive.

Our experience favored the Mediterranean foods over the Italian. The tomato sauce was a bit bland, the pizza a bit bland, the caprese a bit bland. Not bad, just... Not impressive. The gyro and Greek salads were good. Perhaps had I also eaten shawarma this would have been a better review.

Service was fine, but we entered at the start of a rush and the wait staff felt a little overworked. But even with that I had no complaints about the service.

Overall, I'd try Mama Luccis again, but it would be the last chance to wow me.

detailedReviews.author: Papa Torr
detailedReviews.text: I like this place, we've been there twice. No alcohol, for those who care. The menu has a good variety including italian, Middle Eastern kabobs, and some Greek entrees. The four entrees we've tried were tasty with generous portions. Bring cash or pay a slight up charge. I like the murals and seating. I don't live in the area but I would stop here again when driving through.

detailedReviews.author: RB
detailedReviews.text: Nicki was our server, very nice and personable. Great food, awesome atmosphere!

detailedReviews.author: draztikkillz draztikkillz
detailedReviews.text: Mama Lucci's Has incredible Food and Even better customer service! If something goes wrong Which most likely wont happen because of their kick ass staff members, they will quickly and graciously fix the issues! The food is amazing every time the potato soup SLAMS!

detailedReviews.author: Mahmoud Nasreldin
detailedReviews.text:
We recently had the pleasure of dining at Mama Lucci‚Äôs in Leesburg, and it was an experience to remember! The restaurant offers an incredible fusion of authentic Egyptian, Italian, and Greek cuisine, catering to a variety of tastes with unmatched flavor and authenticity.

A heartfelt thank you to the owner Mustafa and his wife, whose dedication and hospitality truly set this place apart. They went above and beyond to ensure our group of 40+ was comfortably seated, served promptly, and treated with the utmost care and attention.

The food was absolutely delicious‚Äîevery dish was crafted to perfection, showcasing bold and fresh flavors that left everyone impressed. The service was exceptional, with staff members displaying professionalism, kindness, and warmth throughout our visit. Despite our large group, everything was delivered on time, and every detail was thoughtfully attended to.

Mama Lucci‚Äôs is a gem for anyone looking to enjoy a unique and memorable culinary experience. We can‚Äôt recommend it enough and look forward to returning soon!

detailedReviews.author: Sherry Brown
detailedReviews.text: Food was hot and very good. Very friendly staff. Would recommend.

detailedReviews.author: Powerpoint Paladin
detailedReviews.text: Chicken parm with pasta was like home-cooked Italian meal and at a very reasonable price!  Not a fancy place but clean and service was very good.  Overall 5 stars for quality and price.  Will be coming back!

detailedReviews.author: Lisa Destefano
detailedReviews.text: My kids and I just tried this place today for the first time. I loved the Falafel and my daughter really enjoyed the spaghetti and meatballs. The portions were so large for the price, and it came with bread and salads. I'm excited for my leftovers! The server was so sweet and perfectly attentive. I liked the atmosphere for a chill dinner with the kids. I'm excited to try more of their mediterranean food bc the flavors were spot on.

detailedReviews.author: Andy Romero
detailedReviews.text: Always extraordinary food !!! Love the steak salad, and the steak and cheese ‚Ä¶ specially at linch time :)

detailedReviews.author: D K
detailedReviews.text: Great cheesesteaks

detailedReviews.author: Tumbleweed Weed
detailedReviews.text: Ordered veal parmigiana with spaghetti and salad. The meal was completely bland and lacked flavor. Meat overcooked, dry, and non-seasoned breading greasy. Salad dressing left out of my order (takeout). Cashier was very friendly and welcoming. I will give it another try but I won‚Äôt be ordering Italian.

detailedReviews.author: Izia
detailedReviews.text: My favorite restaurant I‚Äôve been to in a while. I‚Äôm sad I don‚Äôt live nearby so I can come more frequently. I hope nothing changes for the next time I come!! The food was delicious and there was a very comforting and homey feel to the space. Loved the Italian wedding soup.

detailedReviews.author: Jan Nelson
detailedReviews.text: Mama Luccis is our go to restaurant! If we are out shopping an its time to eat a meal we concluded that driving back to Leesburg to get our meal at Mama Luccis is always the best choice for great food.

detailedReviews.author: mahbub chowdhury
detailedReviews.text: I started going there for halal meat and Italian food.

detailedReviews.author: S
detailedReviews.text: Super fresh food, always a hit

detailedReviews.author: Phuong Tran
detailedReviews.text: I love to eat here each time I visited the store next door, because of the quiet atmosphere, the food was fresh and tasty, and price for lunch special was very good. Stop by when you get a chance come to Leesburg town.

detailedReviews.author: Ayoub Salama
detailedReviews.text: Went here with my gf and my parents was a lovely spot will be back again food was good service was excellent wish there was more space tho kind of packed in still would recommend and come back!

detailedReviews.author: Mattie C
detailedReviews.text: We order here once every two weeks.  Easy pick up on way from work.   Great menu, though admittedly both my wife and I tend to gravitate to the same wonderful meal each time.  The roasted vegetables just melt in your mouth, and the meats are always perfectly cooked.   We keep saying we should try somewhere else, but frankly I think we would both be disappointed.   The wedding soup is amazing, the lamb kabob platter and shrimp kabob platter are our bread and butter after a long day and even longer commute.

detailedReviews.author: S AzMo
detailedReviews.text: Best food and customer service!!!!

detailedReviews.author: Mark Haas
detailedReviews.text: We did not "dine in", but got our pizza "to go" (so atmosphere not rated). Both our cheese and pepperoni pizzas were very good. We always enjoy our pizza from Mama Lucci's!  I was given a FREE large pizza by Mama L's for my birthday---Thank You, Mama Lucci!

detailedReviews.author: William James Baumbach II
detailedReviews.text:
Highly recommended, excellent atmosphere, service, and food, reasonably priced.

Definitely recommended

It's not out on the main drag it's off the beaten path off industrial Road,

They will however charge you extra for paying other credit card

detailedReviews.author: Sasha Kaplan
detailedReviews.text: Great food. Tortellini and lasagna on point. The tiramisu was light and perfectly balanced.

detailedReviews.author: Ann Moore
detailedReviews.text: This is a local family favorite, never disappoints!

detailedReviews.author: Robert DeFruscio
detailedReviews.text: Great food and great service!

detailedReviews.author: Hesham Ali
detailedReviews.text: As always, a great dinning experience! Best Lunch you could ever bring your family and friends to. Very cozy and super friendly staff. Food is so delicious and very reasonably priced.

detailedReviews.author: Moo Moo
detailedReviews.text: Best of the best

detailedReviews.author: Geri Piazza
detailedReviews.text: Mama Lucci‚Äôs is always delicious, and there‚Äôs lots of variety to choose from. This is my favorite neighborhood restaurant in the Burg! ‚ù§Ô∏è

detailedReviews.author: Melissa C. Edmundson
detailedReviews.text: The food and sservice is amazing.

detailedReviews.author: Michael Kacmarcik
detailedReviews.text: We just moved back to the area. Haven't had your food in 20 years. Still as good as we remember.

detailedReviews.author: C R
detailedReviews.text: Wet Friday night called for pizza. Crab soup is unbelievable. Pizza really good! Excited to try the lobster ravioli. Hidden gem tucked in Leesburg. Will probably be our new go to.

detailedReviews.author: Sang Ahn
detailedReviews.text:
Very good restaurant,
I have enjoyed there almost every food~

detailedReviews.author: Heather McCloskey
detailedReviews.text: One of our favorite local restaurants. So many delicious dishes to pick from. Always hot and portions are huge.  Highly recommend.

detailedReviews.author: Chuck Atkins
detailedReviews.text: Best restaurant I've been to in several years.  The soup, salad, and entree were outstanding.  A great place and a great value.

detailedReviews.author: Kristin Gill
detailedReviews.text: Great service, delicious food!

detailedReviews.author: Valerie Martinez
detailedReviews.text: Absolutely loved this place. It was our first time last night and we enjoyed everything about it. Service was great and the food was amazing!!! The lobster ravioli is what I ordered and it was delicious!

detailedReviews.author: Rit Lar
detailedReviews.text: I went in on my lunch break for lunch.  My food was ‚Äúforgotten‚Äù by the kitchen staff. After waiting 15 minutes from when everyone else got their food I had to advise I needed it to go.  Took another 6-7 minutes to come out but I was also handed a check.  They had me pay for food that I don‚Äôt even have time to eat because my lunch break was done.  SUCH BAD service!  That is poor business practice because prior to this I would recommend anyone go here now I will NEVER say that.

detailedReviews.author: Keerthi Manur
detailedReviews.text: We had lunch here last week. We got the lunch menus and all of our dishes were at a very reasonable price, between $10-13 (vegetarian dishes) and came with delicious garlic bread. Food came quickly, server was great. Highly recommend the eggplant parm pasta and sandwich.

detailedReviews.author: Ann Reger
detailedReviews.text: Great food! Quick service! Good price! Everyone is so pleasant!

detailedReviews.author: Candy Nardini
detailedReviews.text: We went Mama Lucci's for the first time and the food was delicious üòã.   Our waitress was very friendly.

detailedReviews.author: thomas sapp
detailedReviews.text: Small portions of meat (lamb and chicken) on the Sovlaki Sub. Not much flavor. Not marinated. I'll pass next time. Customer service was okay. Not worthy of 20 percent tip though.

detailedReviews.author: Laurie Lucey
detailedReviews.text: First time back in 12yrs, even better than before, our office would order lunch from them for our monthly office meetings and my son, Sean Callahan, worked here many years ago.   Love that they don't use any pork products.

detailedReviews.author: Jenny Nelson
detailedReviews.text: Delicious food, excellent service, cute atmosphere.  No alcohol served.  Inside and outside seating.  Wide range on menu.  Very customizable.

detailedReviews.author: Alex
detailedReviews.text: Mostafa and Carolina are very kind and generous owners. They‚Äôll take good care of you. Thank you so much for the great food, we loved it!

detailedReviews.author: Crystal Eden
detailedReviews.text: Service was good, but the silverware was dirty and they served my daughter RAW chicken. It wasn‚Äôt even close to cooked - well luckily we caught it when we went to cut it up for her. They were nice about it and the server apologized, but it definitely put us off from the rest of the meal. We won‚Äôt be going back.

detailedReviews.author: Garett Miles
detailedReviews.text: Good food and reasonable prices

detailedReviews.author: Keith Stewart
detailedReviews.text: My fist time at Mama Lucci‚Äôs. Friday for lunch, was busy but no waiting and fast and very friendly service. Huge menu with great selections. I ordered a falafel gyro with French fries and my friend ordered the veal parmigiana. Baklava and Chocolate cake for desert. Food was delicious, deserts were great. Overall a solid performance in choice, service, flavor, decor and overall value. Looking forward to returning on my next visit to the area.

customerMoodAnalysis.sentimentSummary: Customers are genuinely thrilled with their experience. With an average 4.6/5 rating across 100 recent reviews, your restaurant consistently exceeds expectations.

strengthsPerceived: Mama Lucci's offers a diverse menu with Italian, Mediterranean, and Greek dishes that cater to a variety of tastes, ensuring there's something for everyone, including vegetarians. - social media marketing can showcase this strength
The restaurant consistently provides quick and friendly service, making it a reliable choice for both lunch and dinner. - review management can highlight this positive aspect
Mama Lucci's is known for its authentic and delicious food, with standout dishes like the Eggplant Parmesan and cream of potato soup. - Boostly marketing services can amplify this
improvementOpportunities: Long wait times and order mishandling (e.g., Grubhub order not ready, forgotten lunch order) - Boostly marketing services can improve this
Negative reviews and reputation issues (e.g., bland food, raw chicken served, forgotten salad dressing) - review management can address this concern
Lack of atmosphere/ambiance awareness (e.g., customers appreciating murals and seating, but not widely known) - social media marketing can improve this area

positive.author: Jenny J
positive.text: This is our favorite restaurant. Every items on the menu are interesting. We found ourselves ordered different things every time we visited and they're always excellent! Service always good as well. Nothing to complain of. Will definitely come back again!

neutral.author: Liam Hughes
neutral.text:
Decent food for a decent price. The taste was a bit bland, overall. But maybe that's just because I'm used to too much salt and too much butter. Either way, it meant the meal just wasn't impressive.

Our experience favored the Mediterranean foods over the Italian. The tomato sauce was a bit bland, the pizza a bit bland, the caprese a bit bland. Not bad, just... Not impressive. The gyro and Greek salads were good. Perhaps had I also eaten shawarma this would have been a better review.

Service was fine, but we entered at the start of a rush and the wait staff felt a little overworked. But even with that I had no complaints about the service.

Overall, I'd try Mama Luccis again, but it would be the last chance to wow me.

neutral.text: I love to eat here each time I visited the store next door, because of the quiet atmosphere, the food was fresh and tasty, and price for lunch special was very good. Stop by when you get a chance come to Leesburg town.
